Package millionaire.Model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
millionaire.Model.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
GetJson
public class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements GetJson
The main class of the Model package and it's represent the Model part of the MVC design pattern.
Author:
Mohammad, Henrik, Millad, Jesse

    • getInstance

      public static Game getInstance()
      It returns change question life line object.
      Returns:
      the only possible instance of this class (singleton).

    • setupJsonData

      public void setupJsonData​(java.lang.String data)
      Description copied from interface: GetJson
      It will have behavior to handle json (data) text for example set every json object in a question object from questions array inside game class.(It will be called inside getJsonData() when the data will be ready to use).
      Specified by:
      setupJsonData in interface GetJson
      Parameters:
      data - is a json text that will used inside this method.

    • newGame

      public void newGame​(java.lang.String playerName)
      prepare game object so the user can start new game and reset player name.
      Parameters:
      playerName - create a player name so user can input ID after the game is reset.

    • getMoneyCheckData

      public java.lang.String[] getMoneyCheckData​(boolean withDraw)
      gets balance/date/name and current question to the writercheck
      Parameters:
      withDraw - if withDraw is true the player wont be send back below safety level
      Returns:
      data from users game

    • sendToDB

      private void sendToDB​(java.lang.String[] moneyCheckData) throws java.sql.SQLException
      This method will send information from javafx to database
      Parameters:
      moneyCheckData - An array of string where it contain player's name,balance and date.
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException - An exception that provides information on a database access error or other errors.

    • getQuestionPart

      public java.lang.String getQuestionPart​(byte QuestionPart)
      gets question running if user answer wrong ends the game and calculate score
      Parameters:
      QuestionPart - question stage of the game
      Returns:
      current question and score value

      Parameters:

    • nextQuestion

      public void nextQuestion​(int second)
      create a method that makes game move on to the next question after users have answered and it call a method that increases player score.
      Parameters:
      second - adds points depending on how much seconds it takes for the user to answer.

    • setQuestions

      private void setQuestions()
      It be called to get the needed questions from the back-end.

      Running the selected lifeline
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the different string arrays with hints or question changes.
